Immigration: ^Papers Please Sir. I am asking for your passport, and other legal documents you are bringing to Britain.
^Ah, yes, please give me a moment now.
^No rush sir, you seem to be our only person entering London through this method today.
^Is this your first time travelling to another country?
^Through ship, yes… why do you ask?
^Aha! So I seem to be correct. You do seem to be confused when manoeuvring about this place,
^so how is it so far? Where do you come from?
^"damn… why is this damn immigration officer so damn nosy… let just tell him what information he wants to know and lets just sod off… take it, where do I come from again?"
^Here’s my passport, and my documents sir.
^"Why is he looking at me like that?"
^no no, I just did not expect to see an east german on my doorsteps today, I'm a tad bit surprised
^I see… it's quite rare to see us after all.
^"my name, my name… what’s my alias again?, I should check my passpor-"
^"Crap… it’s with him… what do I do?"
^"wait, why is so polite all of a sudden?"
^All your information so far is accurate, and the documentation seems legitimate
^I see, is there any more procedures for me to do perhaps?
^For all I know I have no reason from stopping you entering Great Britain
^That’s great, thank you sir, and I’ll be on my merry way.
^Oh yes, and one last word for you laddie
Know: ^There is a man whose name is Estienne the Gasser...
^Yes, his name is Estienne the Gasser, who abused and utilised chemical warfare on the battlefield
^I know you are just an innocent lad, but that name gives the living freights to our veterans,
Dontknow: ^During the war, there was a man who abused and utilised chemical warfare on the battlefield.
^I know you are just an innocent lad, but that name gives the living freights to our veterans,
continue: ^oh… I’m terribly sorry for stopping you on your way…
^and if that is the case, I bid you good luck Mr. Estienne.
^I sat quietly in the middle of my coffee store… it had been quite a while since I had had a time of peace,
^all the hard work over the years in working in a hospital as a chemist, but I found that to be boring. But ever since I came to this coffee store, I fell in love with it.
^Now that I own this store, and with my knowledge in organic chemistry, I’ve managed to improve the tastes of the coffees available, and with new tastes, I have gotten more customers as of lately.
^Due to my coffee being relatively cheaper than most other stores, I have gained a bit of a customer following as of recent, such as the successful local real estate owner, Hugh Theravus,
^The local military officer, Korey Wesson, and a surgical assistant, Grant Corvelli. Knowing them all well, they automatically go to their usual spots.
^As I brewed another pot of coffee and prepare another plate of french toast, I hear my door open, and I see a relatively unknown man.
^Hello, welcome to Wellington’s, how may I help you today?
^You know, the owner, Edmund Wellington. I used to be best mates in school with him you see, and the last I heard of him, he was opening a coffee shop of sorts.
^Ah, I’m terribly sorry sir, but Mr. Wellington is no longer the owner of this store. I had bought this store from him a while back when his business was about go bankrupt
^Damn… well, that was an interesting run was it not?
^I believe so. His coffee was the best, and the location very peaceful and convenient
^It’s a shame he’s gone bankrupt like this.
^"I look at the man, he seemed to be displaying a face of nostalgia."
